Responsive Starter Kit, Sass Edition

Overview

A highly functional toolkit to help jump-start a typical responsive web design project. This is a full-featured variation of the more basic responsive starter kit which was primarily created for instructional purposes to introduce basic RWD concepts. This version includes the Sass pre-processor as well as a handful of add-ons for typical responsiveness and can be used on a variety of real-world projects.

Sample HTML files are included to demonstrate possible layouts. There's a basic theme.css file in the assets/css directory. Feel free to edit, or even delete, this file as needed. It's been included for demonstration purposes only. It's not intended to influence visual or user experience design preferences.

Make It Your Own

Have a look around. Take a close look at the source of each HTML page to get started. Load them up in your browser and see how they react at various viewport widths and on various mobile devices. While you're having a look around, be sure to poke around in the CSS files, located in the assets/css directory. You can also find some empty JavaScript starter files in the assets/js directory.

Everything is fair game for editing, changing, and even deleting. This starter kit's main purpose is to get you started down the right path. Add to it, modify it, and even share it with your team. Create your own personalized version of it and then share it with the rest of us.

Getting Started

Before doing anything else, it's a good idea to take a look at the sample layouts (see the list of links under the heading Sample Layouts) to get a basic idea what the starter kit can do.

Sample Layouts

The following demo pages will give you a good understanding of what you can do with this starter kit.

  • Sidebar Left Layout
  • Sidebar Right Layout
  • Three Column Layout
  • Full Width Layout
  • Audio/Video Transcript
  • Sample Form
  • Style Guide
  • Add-ons

Additional Information

The source files for this starter kit are hosted on GitHub. Additional technical details can be found there. If you need a bit more help getting started, take a look at the video training course that goes with the basic version of this starter kit.
